title: Product Tabletop Setup
lighting: Key light: 45° softbox (left), Fill: silver reflector (right)
phara: A clean tabletop setup for product photography, perfect for small objects like watches. The angled camera and softbox create balanced lighting with minimal shadows.

title: Food Flat-Lay Tutorial
phara: A classic food photography style using top-down perspective. Simple props like napkins and cutlery enhance storytelling while soft window light makes the dish appetizing.

title: Macro Jewelry Lighting
lighting: Backlight for rim, Softbox above 30°, Fill card below
phara: Macro setup for capturing sparkle and shine in jewelry. Using velvet reduces reflections, while backlighting and fill cards highlight fine details.

title: Book Still Life Step-by-Step
lighting: Desk lamp warm side-light or ambient light
phara: Step-by-step guide to book photography, showing variations in perspective and lighting. Includes post-processing tips for cropping and contrast enhancement.

title: Glassware Reflections Guide
lighting: Backlight at 60°, Diffuser between light and glass
phara: Guide for shooting glass objects without harsh glare. Using a diffuser and polarizer helps control reflections for a polished studio look.

title: Minimalist Composition (Rule of Thirds)
phara: Illustrates rule of thirds composition for balanced still photography. Simple props and natural light create professional-looking images.

title: Plant Translucence (Backlight)
lighting: Backlight at 45° with reflector for fill
phara: Backlighting emphasizes the translucence of leaves, making them glow naturally. Reflectors balance exposure by filling shadows.

title: Studio Kit Checklist

settings.Notes: Tripod recommended for shutter speeds 1/60s or slower

phara: A quick reference guide showing the essential studio tools for small product photography, with settings suggestions for stability and quality.

title: Angle & Perspective Comparison
lighting: Soft diffused light with angle variations
phara: Comparison of two common perspectives—top-down for flat-lays and low-angle for dramatic emphasis—highlighting how camera position changes the mood.

title: Macro Texture Emphasis (Fabric)
phara: Macro close-up of fabric to highlight texture and weave. Shallow depth of field emphasizes fine details while side-light enhances contrast.

title: Minimalist Lens & Settings Cheat-Sheet

settings.Varies: ISO, aperture, and angle suggestions per object

phara: A cheat-sheet style reference offering quick photography suggestions for different everyday objects.

title: Luxury Product on Black Acrylic
lighting: Softbox high-left, Flag to block spill
phara: Luxurious reflective product setup using acrylic base and polarizers to control glare. Perfect for jewelry, perfumes, and premium products.

title: Lighting Angles Chart
phara: Educational chart showing how light angle changes shadows, highlights, and depth for still photography subjects.

title: Before/After Comparison
lighting: Cluttered vs clean setup with side-diffused light
phara: Visual guide showing how small adjustments—removing clutter, controlling light, and tweaking settings—dramatically improve the result.

title: Creative Props & Storytelling
lighting: Window light from right with diffuser, Warm WB ~3200K
phara: Demonstrates how simple home props like books and glasses can add storytelling depth to a still-life setup, enhancing mood and theme.

title: Foil as Reflector (Vector)
phara: Using a crumpled foil sheet taped to cardboard, you can bounce extra light onto the subject and reduce harsh shadows. This is a simple and effective way to mimic a professional reflector with everyday items.

title: Bedsheet Backdrop (Photoreal)
phara: A plain bedsheet makes an excellent DIY backdrop, giving a clean look to product shots. Pairing it with a foil reflector helps fill shadows and create a soft, home-studio effect.

title: Torch with Diffuser (Mixed)
phara: Covering a torch with baking paper turns it into a soft light source. Combined with a book stack as a tripod, this is a full DIY setup for still-life or product shots.

title: Glass of Water for Light Effects (Photoreal)
phara: Placing a water glass near the subject creates natural refractions and light patterns, adding a dreamy artistic touch to your still-life shots.

title: Colored Paper Background (Vector)
phara: A simple colored paper sheet transforms the background and mood of a shot. Great for DIY product styling without investing in professional backdrops.

title: DIY Lightbox from Cardboard (Mixed)
phara: With just a cardboard box and tissue paper, you can build a DIY lightbox. It diffuses light evenly and eliminates harsh shadows for clean product shots.

title: Kitchen Sieve for Diffusion (Photoreal)
phara: Holding a kitchen sieve between the lamp and subject softens light intensity, reducing glare and creating studio-like soft lighting.

title: Mirror for Creative Reflection (Vector)
phara: A mirror adds creative depth and dimension to still-life images, reflecting the product and doubling visual interest.

title: Colored Plastic as Gel (Photoreal)
phara: Placing colored plastic sheets in front of a light creates DIY gels, letting you add mood and dramatic color tones cheaply.

title: Books as Tripod (Mixed)
phara: When you don’t have a tripod, books are a perfect stand-in. Pair with a desk lamp as your key light for sharp and stable shots.

title: CD for Rainbow Reflections (Mixed)
phara: A CD can scatter light into rainbow streaks, adding a striking sparkle to jewelry or small items.

title: White T-Shirt as Diffuser (Photoreal)
phara: Sunlight filtered through a plain white T-shirt gives a natural, soft, diffused effect for portraits and still objects.

title: Fairy Lights for Bokeh (Vector)
phara: String lights in the background create beautiful out-of-focus bokeh effects, great for cozy storytelling shots.

title: Tissue Paper Color Gel (Photoreal)
phara: Colored tissue paper over a lamp is an easy DIY gel to tint your scene with vibrant hues.

title: Umbrella as Diffuser (Vector)
phara: A simple umbrella can work as a large diffuser, softening sunlight and reducing harsh shadows outdoors.

title: Curtains as Backdrop (Photoreal)
phara: Patterned curtains serve as an instant, textured backdrop for creative DIY photoshoots.

title: Cardboard Tube as Snoot (Mixed)
phara: Attaching a cardboard tube to a lamp narrows the beam, creating dramatic spotlight effects on the subject.

title: Aperture and Depth of Field (Vector)
phara: Using a large aperture (f/2.8) creates a shallow depth of field with a blurred background, while a small aperture (f/16) keeps both subject and background in focus.

title: Rule of Thirds with Props (Vector)
phara: Placing the apple on a stack of books and aligning it with the rule of thirds grid creates balanced composition. A soft light from the left enhances the subject.
